episodeTitle: The Fated Reunion! Save the Captive Fishman
episodeTitleJapanese: 因縁の再会！囚われの魚人を救い出せ
episodeTitleRomanized: Innen no Saikai! Toraware no Gyojin o Sukuidase
description: The Straw Hats discover that Camie's captive friend is Hatchan, the octopus fish-man from the Arlong Pirates who terrorized Nami's village. Despite their history, Nami decides to honor their promise to Camie and rescue Hatchan from Duval's trap.

openingSong.title: We Are! (Animation One Piece 10th Anniversary Ver.)

events.title: Arrival at Duval's Base
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates arrive at the Flying Fish Riders' headquarters to rescue Camie's captive friend. They prepare for a potential confrontation with Duval and his crew.
events.significance: Sets up the rescue mission and upcoming confrontation with Duval.

events.title: Hatchan's Identity Revealed
events.description: The Straw Hats discover that the captive fish-man they came to rescue is Hatchan, the octopus fish-man who was an officer in the Arlong Pirates. This creates immediate tension, especially for Nami, who suffered under Arlong's tyranny.
events.significance: Creates a moral dilemma for the crew and tests Nami's capacity for forgiveness. This moment is crucial for Hatchan's redemption arc and demonstrates how the Straw Hats handle former enemies.

quotes.text: That's Hatchan! He was one of Arlong's officers!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji recognizes Hatchan from their encounter with the Arlong Pirates

events.title: Hatchan's Post-Arlong Life Revealed
events.description: Hatchan explains that after the Arlong Pirates were defeated and captured by the Marines, he was the only one who escaped. He then pursued his dream of becoming a takoyaki chef, opening a floating takoyaki stand called Takoyaki 8.
events.significance: Shows Hatchan's character development from pirate to peaceful chef, establishing his redemption and change from his days with Arlong.

quotes.text: Arlong and the others were captured by the Marines, but I escaped to chase my dream as a takoyaki cook.
quotes.speaker: Hatchan
quotes.context: Hatchan explains what happened after the Arlong Pirates' defeat

events.title: Hatchan's Ink Disguise Attempt
events.description: Recognizing the Straw Hats' ship and fearing they won't save him once they know his identity, Hatchan desperately attempts to disguise himself by covering his body with black ink.
events.significance: Demonstrates Hatchan's remorse and fear of rejection due to his past actions with the Arlong Pirates. The futile disguise attempt adds both tension and comedy to the scene.

events.title: Usopp Explains Arlong's Tyranny
events.description: Usopp explains to the newer crew members (Franky and Brook) about how the Arlong Pirates ruled over Nami's home island of Cocoyasi Village with an iron fist, and how Luffy and the crew defeated them to free Nami and her village.
events.significance: Provides crucial context for new crew members and viewers about Nami's traumatic past and why Hatchan's presence is so significant.

events.title: Zoro and Luffy Initially Abort the Rescue
events.description: Zoro pointedly tells Camie that Hatchan is no friend of theirs, and Luffy initially decides to abort the rescue mission. However, before leaving, Luffy asks Hatchan how good his takoyaki is, showing he's not entirely closed to the idea.
events.significance: Demonstrates the crew's loyalty to Nami by deferring to her judgment. Luffy's question about takoyaki hints at his willingness to give Hatchan a chance.

quotes.text: Hatchan is no friend of ours.
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro makes it clear to Camie that they have history with Hatchan

events.title: Camie and Pappag Jump Overboard to Save Hatchan
events.description: When the Straw Hats prepare to leave without rescuing Hatchan, Camie and Pappag jump overboard in a desperate attempt to save their friend themselves. The Macro Pirates immediately capture them.
events.significance: Camie's selfless action demonstrates true friendship and forces the situation to a critical point, setting up Nami's crucial decision.

events.title: Nami Decides to Honor the Promise
events.description: Seeing Hatchan crying and thrashing in his cage trying to save Camie, Nami makes the decision to rescue him. She tells the crew they promised Camie, and Hatchan is probably harmless to them now. This is a powerful moment of forgiveness from Nami.
events.significance: This is one of the most significant character moments for Nami in the entire series. Despite the trauma she endured under Arlong's rule, she chooses forgiveness and compassion. It shows her emotional growth and strength of character.

quotes.text: We promised Camie. And Hatchan is probably harmless to us by now.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami makes the compassionate decision to rescue Hatchan despite their painful history

events.title: Luffy Rescues Camie and Pappag
events.description: Luffy uses Gomu Gomu no Pistol to retrieve Camie and Pappag from the Macro Pirates, bringing them back to the Thousand Sunny safely.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's quick action once the decision to help is made, and his protective nature toward those the crew has befriended.

events.title: Zoro Frees Hatchan from His Cage
events.description: Zoro cuts through the cage holding Hatchan captive, freeing the octopus fish-man. Despite their past as enemies, Zoro helps save him at Nami's request.
events.significance: Demonstrates the crew's unity and willingness to follow Nami's decision, even if it means helping a former enemy.

events.title: Hatchan Defeats the Macro Pirates
events.description: Once freed, Hatchan uses his six-armed strength to send the Macro Pirates flying with a single powerful punch, demonstrating his considerable fighting abilities.
events.significance: Shows that Hatchan is still a formidable fighter despite leaving the pirate life, and that he's willing to protect his friends.

events.title: Flying Fish Riders Trap Activated
events.description: As the rescue succeeds, Duval activates a trap for the Straw Hat Pirates, surrounding them with his Flying Fish Riders. The stage is set for a major confrontation.
events.significance: Sets up the upcoming battle between the Straw Hats and Duval's crew, and builds anticipation for the reveal of Duval's face and his connection to Sanji.

themes.description: The episode centers on Nami's decision to forgive Hatchan despite his past involvement with the Arlong Pirates who enslaved her village. Hatchan's transformation from pirate to peaceful takoyaki chef represents his redemption arc.
themes.symbolism: Hatchan's attempt to disguise himself with ink symbolizes his shame and desire to hide from his past. Nami's decision to save him anyway represents the possibility of redemption and second chances.

themes.description: The crew's commitment to keeping their promise to Camie, even when it conflicts with their personal feelings about Hatchan, demonstrates the importance of honor and keeping one's word.
themes.symbolism: The promise to Camie becomes a test of the crew's integrity and Nami's capacity for compassion.

themes.description: The entire crew implicitly agrees to leave the decision about rescuing Hatchan entirely to Nami, showing their trust in her judgment and respect for her trauma.
themes.symbolism: The crew's silent deference to Nami's decision shows how deeply they understand and respect each other's pain.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates remarkable emotional growth by choosing to forgive and help Hatchan despite the trauma he and the Arlong Pirates inflicted on her. This decision shows her strength of character and capacity for compassion.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expands on the crew's internal debate about rescuing Hatchan, giving more time to show the crew members' reactions and Nami's emotional processing.

trivia.fact: This episode marks Hatchan's first reappearance since his debut in the Arlong Park Arc (episodes 31-44), approximately 343 episodes later.
The episode aired on February 1, 2009 in Japan, as part of the One Piece anime's tenth anniversary celebration period, which featured the special opening by Tohoshinki.
This episode covers parts of manga chapters 492 and 493, continuing the Sabaody Archipelago Arc which sets up many major events in the series.
Nami's decision to save Hatchan is considered one of her most important character development moments, showing how far she has come from her traumatized past.
